title: Take Your Pills
description: In a hypercompetitive world, drugs like Adderall offer students, athletes, coders and others a way to do more -- faster and better. But at what cost?

title: Teach Us All
description: It's been decades since Brown v. Board of Education, yet American schools remain largely segregated. Some leaders are working to change that.

title: Terms and Conditions May Apply
description: Through interviews with technology thought leaders and futurists, this timely documentary examines the erosion of privacy in the digital age.

title: Testing the Menu
description: Acclaimed chef Nic Watt creates, then tweaks, recipes for his Auckland restaurant by asking ordinary people on the street to give them the taste test.

title: The 100 Years Show
description: This documentary profiles abstract minimalist pioneer Carmen Herrera as she enjoys artistic success and fame that literally took a lifetime to happen.

title: The Alps Murders
description: This investigative documentary sheds light on the baffling 2012 cold-blooded slaying of a British family and a local cyclist in the French Alps.

title: The American Dream Project
description: A British ex-pat New Yorker and his American buddy take a motorcycle journey across the U.S. to see if the spirit of American optimism still exists.
actors: James Michael Terrance Marshall, Todd Williams

title: The Armor of Light
description: In this documentary, a conservative minister attempts to coax his followers to consider America's gun culture through a moral lens.

title: The Art of Organized Noize
description: This documentary charts the rise of Organized Noize, the influential producers behind megahits from Outkast, Goodie Mob, TLC and more.
actors: Sleepy Brown, Raymond Murray, Rico Wade

title: The B-Side: Elsa Dorfman's Portrait Photography
description: Filmmaker Errol Morris probes the life, work and studio of his pal Elsa Dorfman, a Polaroid photographer who's shot luminaries and regular folk alike.

title: The Bad Kids
description: In this documentary, teachers at a Mojave Desert high school adhere to a belief that compassion and life skills can profoundly help at-risk students.

title: The Black Panthers: Vanguard of the Revolution
description: Police informants, journalists, supporters and detractors contribute to this documentary look at the history of the controversial Black Panther Party.

title: The Bleeding Edge
description: This eye-opening look at the fast-growing medical device industry reveals how the rush to innovate can lead to devastating consequences for patients.

title: The Bomb
description: Form, montage and mesmerizing kinetics propel this experimental meditation on the destructive power of the nuclear bomb, featuring music by The Acid.

title: The C Word
description: To solve the mystery of cancer, challenging the status quo is a must. Witness how lifestyle and societal changes may help beat the disease.

title: The Champions
description: This documentary follows the pit bulls that are rescued from the dogfighting ring of NFL quarterback Michael Vick and given a second chance at life.

title: The Doors: When You're Strange
description: Composed entirely of footage from 1966 to 1971, this documentary pays tribute to the Doors and their music, revealing many new insights into the band.
actors: Johnny Depp, Jim Morrison, John Densmore, Robby Krieger

title: The Eccentrics
description: This series profiles a selection of unique and fascinating individuals from around the world, exploring what exactly makes them who they are.

title: The Eighties
description: This nostalgic documentary series relives the 1980s from a variety of angles, exploring its impact on the politics, technology and culture of today.

title: The Farthest: Voyager in Space
description: This documentary chronicles NASA's 1977 launch of twin space probes, sent to capture images of remote planets and bear messages from Earth.

title: The Fighting Season
description: This documentary series goes to the front lines in Afghanistan, where the U.S. Army is working together with Afghan soldiers to defeat the Taliban.

title: The First Monday in May
description: Art and celebrity power this documentary that delves behind the scenes of 2015's China-themed Met Gala, the fashion world's most dynamic annual event.

title: The First World War From Above
description: Aerial footage from 1919 captures the battlefields of World War I, revealing the destruction and devastation inflicted across Europe.

title: The Force
description: This documentary follows the police of Oakland, California, as they reform and face the challenges of corruption, commitment and cataclysmic change.

title: The Game 365
description: TV broadcaster and former baseball player Fran Healy interviews icons from the world of sports about their time in the sun.

title: The Girl Whose Muscles are Turning to Bone
description: Few people are as courageous as young Luciana Wulken, a 7-year-old who must fight an extremely rare condition that turns her muscles to bone.

title: The Hard Stop
description: This documentary takes a big-picture look at the death of a black man killed during a 2011 arrest in Tottenham that ignited riots throughout England.

title: The Heart of Man
description: A retelling of the prodigal son parable interspersed with true stories from people who've dealt with personal shame over perceived moral failings.

title: The House on Coco Road
description: This film chronicles the journey of Fannie Haughton, an Oakland activist who fled to Grenada with her family just prior to the U.S. invasion in 1983.

title: The Hunting Ground
description: This exposé tackles the disturbing epidemic of sexual assault on college campuses and school officials' efforts to cover up the crimes.

title: The Ivory Game
description: Filmmakers infiltrate the corrupt global network of ivory trafficking, exposing poachers and dealers as African elephants edge closer to extinction.

title: The Last Laugh
description: Comedians, writers and entertainment icons discuss whether it's ever permissible to joke about horrible tragedies like the Holocaust, AIDS and 9/11.

title: The Last Man on the Moon
description: Astronaut Gene Cernan looks back on the exciting history of NASA's lunar landings and how being the last man to stand on the moon changed his life.

title: The Last Secrets of 9/11
description: With more than a thousand victims of 9/11 still missing, forensic teams continue their work to identify remains and bring closure to the families.

title: The Legend of 420
description: This documentary explores the growing trend of marijuana decriminalization in the U.S. and the use of cannabis in medicine, art, fine dining and more.

title: The Lion in Your Living Room
description: Experts travel the world to explore the enigmas of the common house cat, from its history of domestication to the science behind its purring.

title: The Magic of Mushrooms
description: Not merely a pizza topping, mushrooms play a vital role in the world, which is revealed in this nature program hosted by professor Richard Fortey.

title: The Magic Pill
description: Doctors, farmers, chefs and others weigh in on the controversial ketogenic diet and its potential to eradicate common illnesses.

title: The Making of VGHS: The Behind the Scenes Feature Documentary
description: Go behind the scenes to learn how "Video Game High School" was made and enjoy special interviews with the cast and crew. Get Schooled!
actors: Josh Blaylock, Johanna Braddy, Brian Firenzi, Ellary Porterfield

title: The Man Who Killed Richard III
description: Evidence reveals Sir Rhys ap Thomas of Wales may have dealt the fatal blow to England's King Richard III that paved the way for the Tudor monarchy.

title: The Man Who Would Be Polka King
description: This irreverent documentary reveals how charming entertainer Jan Lewan bilked investors out of millions in a complicated investment scam.

title: The Mars Generation
description: Self-professed teenage "space nerds" at Space Camp chase their dreams of traveling to Mars, while experts reflect on NASA's history and future.
actors: Neil deGrasse Tyson, Bill Nye, Michio Kaku

title: The Meaning of Monty Python
description: Five Pythons reflect on their creative process, politics, television and the making of their award-winning final film, "The Meaning of Life."

title: The Messenger
description: This documentary looks at the history of songbirds and speculates on what losing this imperiled species could mean for humanity.

title: The Mind of a Chef
description: Producer and narrator Anthony Bourdain explores the creative processes of international celebrity chefs to learn what fuels their culinary artistry.
actors: Anthony Bourdain, David Chang, Sean Brock, April Bloomfield

title: The Mitfords: A Tale of Two Sisters
description: Jessica and Diana were sisters who were separated by just a few years in age. But their political ideologies couldn't have been any farther apart.

title: The Mortified Guide
description: Brave people get onstage to read hilarious and humiliating tales of gawky teenage love, family dysfunction and other stories from their younger years.

title: The Most Unknown
description: Traversing disciplines from physics to psychology, nine scientists share ideas and seek common ground by delving into deep existential questions.

title: The Naked Truth
description: Investigative journalists tackle complex and under-reported subjects ranging from online extortion to fentanyl addiction and partisan gerrymandering.

title: The Nineties
description: This U.S.-focused series dives into the cultural and political changes that swept the last decade of the 20th century. Executive produced by Tom Hanks.

title: The Other One: The Long Strange Trip of Bob Weir
description: This chronicle of Bob Weir highlights his brotherhood with Jerry Garcia and his success as a member of one of the world's most influential bands.

title: The Paedophile Next Door
description: Calling for action where legislation has failed, this topical film explores alternative strategies for keeping kids safe from sexual predators.

title: The Pixar Story
description: Go behind the scenes at Pixar Animation Studios with this Emmy-nominated documentary tracing the creation and history of the groundbreaking company.

title: The Power of Grayskull: The Definitive History of He-Man and the Masters of the Universe
description: This colorful documentary explores the origins and impact of He-Man, a character whose power stretched well beyond a toy line and children's TV show.

title: The Rachel Divide
description: Rachel Dolezal, her family and her critics reckon with the aftermath of a national debate sparked by questions about her racial identity.

title: The Real Death Star
description: This documentary examines theories behind the creation of gamma ray bursts, destructive explosions in space that can wipe out entire star systems.

title: The Real Sleeping Beauty
description: A medical miracle is chronicled in this documentary about a woman who shocks experts when she awakens from a 20-year coma with the power of speech.

title: The Real Texas Chainsaw Massacre
description: Working on a tip, police start to unravel the case of a British former mental patient who hoarded guns and may have links to a famous Texas crime.

title: The Return
description: This film examines the many challenges of reintegration faced by convicts and their families after a new law mandates the prisoners' early release.

title: The Road Trick
description: Illusionist Adam Trent uses magic as a bridge between cultures as he crosses Europe, connecting with locals and seeking out one-of-a-kind experiences.

title: The Russian Revolution
description: Starting in 1881, this film describes how the personal battle between the royal Romanovs and Lenin's Ulyanov family led to the Russian Revolution.

title: The Search for Life in Space
description: To determine whether we're alone in the universe, astrobiologists look to Jupiter, Mars and, closer to home, extreme environments on Earth.

title: The Search For Life: The Drake Equation
description: In 1961, American astrophysicist Frank Drake transformed attitudes about the search for extraterrestrial life by writing a revolutionary equation.

title: The Secret
description: An assembly of writers, philosophers and scientists share The Secret, which reputedly brought success to Plato, da Vinci, Einstein and other greats.

title: The Secret Rules of Modern Living: Algorithms
description: In this documentary, mathematics professor Marcus Du Sautoy reveals the hidden world of algorithms and how these 2,000-year-old problem solvers work.

title: The Seven Five
description: This riveting film examines the case of Mike Dowd, a corrupt Brooklyn cop who became dirtier than the drug dealers he was supposed to be policing.

title: The Seventies
description: This series examines 1970s America, focusing on the major political and historical landmarks of the decade and the cultural response to those events.

title: The Skyjacker's Tale
description: Years after hijacking a plane full of passengers and seeking asylum in Cuba, a convicted mass murderer still refuses to call himself a criminal.

title: The Strange Name Movie
description: Ordinary people with extraordinary names open up about the ridicule, judgment and rewards that come with having an attention-grabbing moniker.

title: The Surrounding Game
description: Teens in America dedicate themselves to the Asian game of Go, which originated in ancient China, drawing meaningful life lessons along the way.

title: The Testimony
description: This short film chronicles the largest rape trial in Congo's history, in which soldiers stood accused of a brutal rampage against their own citizens.

title: The Tigers of Scotland
description: This documentary highlights the endangered existence of the Scottish wildcats, and the conservation efforts required to prevent their extinction.

title: The Toys That Made Us
description: The minds behind history's most iconic toy franchises discuss the rise -- and sometimes fall -- of their billion-dollar creations.

title: The True Cost
description: The links between consumer pressure for low-cost high fashion and the meager existences of the sweatshop workers who produce those goods are explored.

title: The Vietnam War: A Film by Ken Burns and Lynn Novick
description: Ken Burns and Lynn Novick present an epic chronicle of the Vietnam War, featuring the soldiers, protesters, politicians and families who lived it.

title: The War: A Film by Ken Burns and Lynn Novick
description: A seven-part series brings World War II to life through the harrowing personal accounts of soldiers and others from "typical" American towns.

title: The White Helmets
description: As daily airstrikes pound civilian targets in Syria, a group of indomitable first responders risk their lives to rescue victims from the rubble.

title: The Wildebeest Migration
description: This documentary captures one of nature's most dramatic events: the perilous 2,000-mile annual migration of African wildebeests across the Serengeti.

title: The Woman with 7 Personalities
description: A woman reconnects with a friend who has seven distinct personalities, while also consulting with psychological experts about the rare condition.

title: The Woman with No Face
description: When a rare form of cancer ravages her face, young model Tambu Makinzi undergoes groundbreaking surgery to have the giant tumor removed.

title: Theater of Life
description: This documentary follows chef Massimo Bottura as he opens a soup kitchen to cook gourmet meals for the needy from food waste at the 2015 Milan Expo.

title: Theo Who Lived
description: American journalist Theo Padnos retraces the Middle Eastern journey that led to his 2012 kidnapping and brutal torture by an al-Qaida faction.

title: They Shall Not Perish: The Story of Near East Relief
description: In the early 20th century, selfless Americans from many walks of life came together to save the lives of refugees in the wake of Armenian genocide.

title: They’ll Love Me When I’m Dead
description: Actors, crew members and others who were there discuss the tumultuous creation of Orson Welles's final, unfinished film, “The Other Side of the Wind.”

title: This Is the Life
description: Examine how the group of alternative hip-hop artists known as the Good Lifers started a movement and created a robust, progressive musical community.
actors: Abstract Rude, Chali 2na, Cut Chemist, Ellay Khule

title: Time: The Kalief Browder Story
description: This series traces the tragic case of Kalief Browder, a Bronx teen who spent three horrific years in jail, despite never being convicted of a crime.

title: To Be a Miss
description: Explore how the media and nationalism have fueled Venezuela's passion for physical appearance and the multibillion-dollar beauty pageant industry.

title: Tony Robbins: I Am Not Your Guru
description: Tony Robbins' clients swear by his unorthodox life coaching methods. A revealing film goes behind the curtain at his annual mega-event.

title: Tower
description: Combining archival footage, animation and interviews, this innovative film explores the 1966 mass shooting from the University of Texas's clock tower.
actors: Violett Beane, Louie Arnette, Blair Jackson, Monty Muir

title: Travis: A Soldier's Story
description: After Army Staff Sgt. Travis Mills loses his limbs while serving in Afghanistan, he begins a courageous battle to rebuild his life at home.

title: Tree Man
description: Entrepreneurs from Vermont and Quebec sell Christmas trees on the streets of New York, becoming a cherished part of neighborhood holiday traditions.

title: Tricked
description: This in-depth documentary examines all sides of America's sex-trafficking trade, which destroys lives as it generates $3 billion a year.

title: Trophy
description: This documentary explores the tensions between the lucrative big-game hunting business and wildlife conservation from a variety of perspectives.

title: Trump: An American Dream
description: Friends, associates and critics reveal the truly American story of Donald Trump, the brash businessman who defied the odds to become U.S. president.

title: Truth and Power
description: This documentary series focuses on individuals and groups who expose freedom-crushing practices in private corporations and the government.

title: Twinsters
description: This documentary chronicles the true story of a French fashion student who discovered via the Internet an identical twin she never knew existed.
